label.text: Rising Sea Level

The rate of sea level rise has doubled in the past 30 years. Sea levels are predicted to continue to rise, with some predictions estimating sea levels could rise up to 63 centimetres by 2100. Such sea level rises will have global impacts.

The maps below show the location of Jakarta, the capital of Indonesia, and the amount of land predicted to be submerged in Jakarta if sea levels continue to rise. The environmental and overpopulation issues facing Jakarta, including the risk of building collapse, are considered to be so severe that the city will soon be replaced as Indonesia’s capital by Nusantara, a city being built on the island of Borneo.
‌Map of Jakarta, Indonesia (top) and the amount of land in Jakarta predicted to be submerged by 2025 and 2050 (bottom).

Which of the following factors contribute to rising sea levels?
Select all correct answers.
an increase in rain falling in coastal regions and running into the sea
an increase in the volume of seawater caused by an increase in average global temperature
an increase in the amount of rubbish being dumped into the sea
an increase in the volume of seawater from melting ice sheets and glaciers
People have made a number of predictions about the impact of global warming.
Are the following impacts consequences of rising sea levels?
Select ‘Yes’ or ‘No’ for each prediction.
Coastal communities will experience more flooding from high tides and storm surges.
The extent of sea ice in polar regions will be greatly reduced.
More people will move inland, requiring construction of new homes and facilities.
The capital city of Indonesia is being replaced for several reasons, including the risk of rising sea levels.
For many places that will be affected by rising sea levels, relocation may not be possible.
What is one action that a city could take to prevent the damage caused by rising sea levels?
